questions.question: How do I get page metadata?
questions.answer: Call `addOnUISdk.app.document.getPagesMetadata()` with range and optional pageIds parameters.

questions.question: What does getPagesMetadata return?
questions.answer: Always returns an array of PageMetadata objects, even for single pages.

questions.question: How do I get specific pages metadata?
questions.answer: Use `range: specificPages` and provide an array of page IDs in the pageIds parameter.

questions.question: What properties are in PageMetadata?
questions.answer: id, size, title, hasPremiumContent, hasVideoContent, hasAudioContent, hasAnimatedContent, temporalContentDuration, pixelsPerInch.

questions.question: What is hasPremiumContent used for?
questions.answer: Indicates if the page contains premium content, helpful for rendition permissions and export controls.

questions.question: What does hasTemporalContent indicate?
questions.answer: Shows if the page contains time-based content like videos or animations.

questions.question: What are common use cases?
questions.answer: Determining page size, checking for premium content before export, and identifying temporal content duration.

questions.question: How do I get the currently selected page IDs?
questions.answer: Call `await addOnUISdk.app.document.getSelectedPageIds()` to retrieve an array of selected page IDs. Note: This is an experimental API.
